pages.text: The most integral machine to be constructed. The alloy furnace allows for the creation of alloys. Alloys are used for crafting but more importantly for tool creation. $(br2)The various alloys that can be made in the Alloy Furnace are found at $(l:alloying/alloy_furnace_alloys)Alloy Furnace Alloys$() and in JEI.

The alloy furnace has 6 input slots for materials and one slot for a template. The top right blue slot is for a alloy template which allows for custom automation of different alloys. See $(l:machines/template_table)Template Table$() for automation details. The fuel slot and output slot are similar to a standard furnace. The 6 remaining slots are the inputs for various materials. See $(l:alloying/alloying)NotesAbout Alloying$() for explanation on materials.

The input inventory can contain duplicates and inputs can be placed in any order. The furnace will also calculate and display the output before inserting fuel. If a valid recipe is detected and fuel is present the furnace will start.

The output alloy will have NBT data containg the percentages of the materials used to create it. This means the same alloy created with various percentages can be used differently and will not stack, however, they are the same item and will still work for generic crafting recipes. This means it is possible to have crafting recipes require specific percentage alloys.
